main event: Military personnel observed a stationary spherical object at approximately 20,000 to 40,000 feet on July 16, 1949, for about 1.5 hours.
interesting points: The object was first observed around 0500 hours and had a reflective shine similar to aluminum., The sighting was made using 7x binoculars from the control tower at Fairfield-Suisun Air Force Base., Four different military observers reported the sighting., The object remained motionless throughout the observation period., The object eventually disappeared into a layer of haze.
sighted object: a large spherical object with a metallic appearance
witness description: military personnel including rank of PFC, S/Sgt, T/Sgt, and Capt.
